channel.title: K³ Research Documentation Project
channel.description: Recent content on K³ Research Documentation Project

item.title: Writing an iOS Kernel Exploit from Scratch
Small Mistakes Lead To Big Problems
item.description: Introduction While I don’t have much time at the moment for my FreeBSD kernel exploitation project, I needed a small break and had a look at a smaller PHP project. I searched for something which is small enough to read the code fast in its entirety to improve my general source code assessment skills. I ended with PHPLiteAdmin, a small project which seems to be something like PHPMyAdmin but for SQLite database files.

item.title: Every Journey Starts with a FAIL
item.description: Introduction Not long ago I started looking into FreeBSD kernel exploitation. There are only a few ressources but probably the best starting point is argp’s Phrack article from 2009. And while he does only provide one technique, I wanted to understand it and port it to a modern FreeBSD release before describing new, own researched techniques. Well, at least this was my plan. In reality I ended researching how different operating systems resp.
